item.title: Switching between Python and R
item.description: Reticulate is a super helpful tool if you need to go between Python and R. Say you want to load a data set in python but manipulate it with dplr functions in RStudio; reticulate is the tool for you! Another time when reticulate could be helpful is if you are trying to graph data (maybe using ggplot()) that you previously mantipulated with python. library(reticulate) x <- "If you need to go" y = "between r and python, use reticulate.
